node.title: The Projectionist: Jared Leto and Judi Dench could get surprise nominations.
node.alt: Judi Dench with Jude Hill in Kenneth Branagh’s “Belfast.”
node.description: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling
node.content: ["Oscar prognostication involves reporting (talking to academy voters), a deep knowledge of academy voting patterns (data crunching), the reading of tea leaves from other awards entities (the Producers Guild Awards are often predictive) and old-fashioned gut instinct. Our player in this game, Kyle Buchanan, a.k.a. the Projectionist, made his nomination predictions last week.", "\u201cWith the diminished Golden Globes off the air and the Critics Choice Awards pushed back to March because of the Omicron variant,\u201d he wrote, \u201cno televised awards show has had the chance to dominate the run-up to these selections, and Oscar voters may gravitate toward some surprising picks as a result.\u201d", "Jared Leto, for instance, could show up in the supporting actor category. (\u201cA prosthetics-laden Leto does the sort of high-voltage transformation in \u2018House of Gucci\u2019 that voters love, even if critics are tempted to sneer.\u201d) And don\u2019t count out Judi Dench, who could make it in as a coattail nominee for \u201cBelfast,\u201d Kenneth Branagh\u2019s black-and-white memoir of his childhood in a turbulent Northern Ireland.", "Leto won a supporting Oscar for \u201cDallas Buyers Club\u201d in 2014. A seven-time nominee, Dench picked up a little gold man in 1999 for her supporting role in \u201cShakespeare in Love.\u201d"]
